get.description: Retrieves the current schema and data retention setting for the specified Elasticsearch Index.

parameters.description: Name of the Elasticsearch index to retrieve the current schema and data retention setting for (without tenant prefix)
parameters.name: indexName

parameters.description: Set to true for a detailed schema response (not a valid Elasticsearch mapping)
parameters.name: verbose

Example Response when 'verbose' = false.description:
Returns the current Elasticsearch Index Schema and data retention setting.
    schemaJson is a valid Elasticsearch Index Mapping.

Example Response when 'verbose' = true.description:
Returns a more descriptive Elasticsearch Index schema mapping and data retention setting.
    However, the schemaJson will not be a valid Elasticsearch Index Mapping.

200.description: Successfully fetched the current Elasticsearch Index Schema

get.summary: Get Current Elasticsearch Index Schema

parameters.description: Name of the Elasticsearch index to retrieve the current schema for (without tenant prefix)
parameters.name: indexName

get.description: Retrieves a list of all updates to the schema and data retention setting for a specified index.

parameters.description: Name of the index to fetch schema and data retention setting updates for (without tenant prefix)
parameters.name: indexName

parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.
parameters.name: sort

get.summary: Get All Schema Updates for the Elasticsearch Index

post.description:
Creates a new Elasticsearch index with the provided schema mapping, default ingestion pipeline and data retention setting.
This operation allows setting an optional default ingestion pipeline and optional retention period for automatic data expiration.

- defaultPipeline: Specifies the pipeline through which the documents will go through for modification or validation purpose before getting indexed. Defaults to null if not provided.

- ttlHours: Specifies the data retention duration in hours. Defaults to 720 hours (30 days) if not provided.
  Set to -1 to disable data expiration, allowing data to persist indefinitely.

- ttlField: The schema field path used to track document expiration for data retension. This field path is required if
  ttlHours is not -1 and must exist in the schema.

NOTE: ttlField mapping type should be 'date' or 'long'.
      If ttlField is of type 'long', it is assumed to be storing epoch milliseconds.

**Using Verbose Mode:**

To use verbose mode when retrieving the schema later with `verbose=true`, you can include a `_meta` field
in your schema. This field contains descriptions for each field and follows the structure of `properties`.
The `_meta` field allows you to add human-readable descriptions to both top-level and nested fields in your schema.

parameters.description: Name of the index to create (excluding the tenant prefix). This serves as a unique identifier within the Elasticsearch cluster.
parameters.name: indexName

Request with _meta field.description:
Use this structure to provide a descriptive schema with the '_meta' field for verbose mode.
    The '_meta' field contains descriptions for each field, which are displayed when 'verbose=true'.
Request with _meta field.summary: Example request body with _meta for verbose schema.

_meta.description: Detailed index schema for user actions.

actionTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the user action occurred.

pipeline.description: Pipeline to validate user.name field is required

script.source: if (ctx.containsKey('user') == false || ctx.user == null) { throw new Exception('user object is required'); } if (ctx.user.containsKey('name') == false || ctx.user.name == null || ctx.user.name == '') { throw new Exception('user.name field is required and cannot be empty'); }

requestBody.description: The schema, default ingestion pipeline and data retention setting in JSON format.

post.summary: Create Elasticsearch Index with given schema, default ingestion pipeline and data retention setting

put.description:
Updates the schema, default ingestion pipeline and data retention setting for an existing Elasticsearch index.
The update applies schema changes and, if applicable, to default ingestion pipeline and data retention setting to manage data retention
effectively within the index. The existing default ingestion pipeline and data retention setting is retained unless explicitly modified.

NOTE: ttlField mapping type should be `date` or `long`.
      If ttlField is of type `long`, it is assumed to be storing epoch milliseconds.

You can send the schema in the request body as a JSON object. To make use of 'verbose=true'
when retrieving the schema, include a `_meta` field in the schema to provide descriptions for each field.
The `_meta` field should follow the structure of `properties`, with descriptions for top-level and nested fields.

parameters.description: The name of the index to update, excluding the tenant prefix. This is the unique identifier for the index within the Elasticsearch cluster.
parameters.name: indexName

Request with _meta field.description:
Use this structure to provide a descriptive schema with the `_meta` field for verbose mode.
The `_meta` field contains descriptions for each field, which are displayed when `verbose=true`.
Request with _meta field.summary: Example request body with _meta for verbose schema.

_meta.description: Detailed index schema for user actions.

actionTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the user action occurred.

pipeline.description: Pipeline to validate user.name and user.age fields are required

script.source: if (ctx.containsKey('user') == false || ctx.user == null) { throw new Exception('user object is required'); } if (ctx.user.containsKey('name') == false || ctx.user.name == null || ctx.user.name == '') { throw new Exception('user.name field is required and cannot be empty'); } if (ctx.user.containsKey('age') == false || ctx.user.age == null || ctx.user.age < 0) { throw new Exception('user.age field is required and cannot be null or negative'); }

requestBody.description: The schema and data retention setting in JSON format.

put.summary: Update Elasticsearch Index with given schema, default ingestion pipeline and data retention setting

get.description: Executes a search operation in the specified Elasticsearch index with additional query parameters.

parameters.description: Name of the Elasticsearch index to search in.
parameters.name: indexName

get.summary: Search Data in Elasticsearch Index

post.description:
Executes a search operation in the specified Elasticsearch index using a search query. This endpoint allows for complex, JSON-based search queries to be submitted in the request body.
For details on building queries, refer to the Elasticsearch Query Documentation.

parameters.description: The name of the Elasticsearch index to search.
parameters.name: indexName

Elasticsearch Query Example.summary: This query retrieves the documents (up to 10) where the field matches the value

requestBody.description: JSON body for querying the Elasticsearch index

post.summary: Execute a search query on the specified index

post.description:
Deletes multiple documents from the specified Elasticsearch index based on the query. This endpoint supports deletion of documents that match a given JSON-based query.
For detailed guidelines on constructing queries, please refer to the Elasticsearch Delete By Query Documentation.

parameters.description: The name of the Elasticsearch index.
parameters.name: indexName

Elasticsearch Query Example.summary: Example of a match query for Elasticsearch

requestBody.description: JSON query for selecting documents to delete.

post.summary: Delete documents by query

post.description:
This endpoint inserts a new document into the specified datastore. It automatically generates a unique ID for the document.
For details on building queries, refer to the Elasticsearch Insertion into Specified Index.

parameters.description: The name of the datastore.
parameters.name: indexName

requestBody.description: The document to be inserted without an ID

400.description: Bad request. Invalid input or malformed JSON.

404.description: Index not found or invalid index name.

post.summary: Insert a document without specifying an ID

post.description:
This endpoint updates an existing document in the specified datastore using its unique identifier (ID). The update can be performed either using a script or directly via the 'doc' object for partial field updates.
For details on building queries, refer to the Elasticsearch Query Documentation.

parameters.description: The name of the datastore.
parameters.name: indexName

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the document to update.
parameters.name: id

Doc-Based Update.summary: Uses the doc field to partially update fields.

Script-Based Update.summary: Uses a script to update a field value.

requestBody.description: JSON body for updating a document via script or doc object.

400.description: Bad request. Invalid input or malformed JSON.

404.description: Document not found or index not found.

post.summary: Update a document by identifier

post.description:
This endpoint updates documents in the specified datastore that match the provided query. The update is done using a script, and only the documents matching the query will be updated.
For details on building queries, refer to the Elasticsearch Query Documentation.

parameters.description: The name of the  datastore.
parameters.name: indexName

requestBody.description: JSON body with the update script and query

400.description: Bad request. Invalid input or malformed JSON.

404.description: Index not found or invalid query.

post.summary: Update documents by query

get.description: Returns the original URL corresponding to the provided short code.

parameters.description: Short code for the original URL
parameters.name: shortCode

get.summary: Get the original URL from a short code

post.description:
Returns a short code for the original URL. Retention and time unit are optional.
By default, retention is 1 and the time unit is DAYS (i.e., 1 day = 86400 seconds).

parameters.description: The original URL to shorten
parameters.name: originalUrl

parameters.description: Retention duration (defaults to 1)
parameters.name: retention

parameters.description: Time unit for retention (e.g., SECONDS, MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS). Defaults to DAYS
parameters.name: unit

post.summary: Generate a short code from a long URL

get.description: Redirects the user to the original URL using the provided short code.

parameters.description: Short code for the original URL
parameters.name: shortCode

get.summary: Redirect to the original URL

put.description:
Updates the original URL and an optional retention duration associated with the specified short code.
If the retention duration is not provided, it defaults to 1 day.

parameters.description: The short code whose mapping is to be updated
parameters.name: shortCode

parameters.description: The new original URL to associate with the given short code
parameters.name: newOriginalUrl

parameters.description: New retention duration value
parameters.name: retention

parameters.description:
Time unit for the retention duration (e.g., SECONDS, MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS).
This parameter is required if 'retention' is provided.
parameters.name: unit

put.summary: Update the original URL and retention duration for a short code

properties.description: A list of properties  associated with this entity.

deviceType.description: Type of devices that needs be queried for ex: bluetooth, probe. Default value is probe.

macAddress.description: Mac address of the device to determine the site in which the location needs to be found.

radius.description: The radius of the search area in kilometers

excludeTags.description: Exclude elements that contain any of the specified tags

items.description: Exclude elements that contain any of the specified tags

tags.description: Return elements that contain all the specified tags

items.description: Return elements that contain all the specified tags

tags.description: tags for human

excludeTags.description: Exclude elements that contain any of the specified tags

items.description: Exclude elements that contain any of the specified tags

tags.description: Return elements that contain all the specified tags

items.description: Return elements that contain all the specified tags

attributes.example: Human:['Human','Male','Female','Mask','No Mask','Neutral','Smile','Angry','Surprise','Sad','Appeared' ,'Disappeared' ,'age 0-9','age 10-19','age 20-29','age 30-39','age 40-49','age 50-59','age 60-69','age 70-79','age 80 and above'] Vehicle:['Car','Bus','Bike','Truck','Bus presence','Car presence']

items.example: Human:['Human','Male','Female','Mask','No Mask','Neutral','Smile','Angry','Surprise','Sad','Appeared' ,'Disappeared' ,'age 0-9','age 10-19','age 20-29','age 30-39','age 40-49','age 50-59','age 60-69','age 70-79','age 80 and above'] Vehicle:['Car','Bus','Bike','Truck','Bus presence','Car presence']

duration.description: Duration of the entity's presence at the location, measured in milliseconds

entityId.description: A unique identifier assigned to the entity

sessionEnd.description: The end timestamp when the entity was last seen at the location, in milliseconds since epoch

sessionStart.description: The start timestamp when the entity was first seen at the location, in milliseconds since epoch

externalRefId.description: The external reference ID for the site

fullName.description: The fully qualified name of the site in KloudHybird

name.description: The name of the site in KloudHybrid

additionalProperties.description: Name value information of user and/or device.

info.description: Name value information of user and/or device.

bookingCode.description: The booking code for the next booking for the day

apikey.description: ID and secret for access to the API

Authorization.description: JWT token obtained from the Login Token Management API
